author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A timeless classic that captures the essence of the Jazz Age with its gripping narrative and unforgettable characters.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopian novel that serves as a stark warning about the dangers of totalitarianism and surveillance.

author: Harper Lee
review: A profound exploration of justice, morality, and racial inequality in the American South, told through the eyes of a young girl.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A poignant portrayal of teenage angst and alienation, capturing the disillusionment and search for identity of its protagonist.

author: Jane Austen
review: A delightful comedy of manners that explores themes of love, class, and societal expectations in Regency-era England.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An epic fantasy masterpiece that transports readers to a richly imagined world filled with adventure, magic, and heroic quests.
